_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The qualities of those who went forth fr: They’re not devious, deceitful, and sneaky.
They’re not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, and loose-tongued.
They guard their sense doors and eat in moderation.
They care about the ascetic life and keenly respect the training.
They’re not indulgent or slack, nor are they leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion.
They’re mindful, with situational awareness, immersion, and unified minds; wise, not stupid.
The thoughts and speech of those who hea: They drink it up and devour it, as it were.
They say: ‘It’s good, sirs, that he draws his spiritual companions away from the unskillful and establishes them in the skillful.’
The agreement between the two spiritual: The woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and had bathed their head.
Those gentlemen who went forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith.
